rooms.description:
You raise your tired eyes from the moniter and see the clock: 10:50 pm.
You need a break from this stuffy dorm room and A2. Yes, even the wonder which
is functional programming can be too much.

You think of boba.

You are determined.

As you try to leave the room, your roommate asks if you can get a cup of
boba for him too. You agree. He says he will Venmo you later.

___________________________________________________________________________

DIRECTION:

Look for *starred* or CAPITALIZED words that denote either relevant items or
legal directions. In-game keywords you can use are "drop", "take",
"inspect", "look at", "go "+a legal direction (or the direction by itself),
"inventory" (or "inv"), "look", "score", "turns", and "quit".

Check your inventory!

Enter START to start the game!

You realize that since your roommate is inside the room, you won't need your
*keys*. So you LEAVE them in the room.

The door leads OUTSIDE to the hallway.

The hallway feels much nicer than your room. You definitely feel better
than being INSIDE your rooom.

You walk NORTH towards the stairs.

You can go UP to see a friend of yours who also madly loves boba--
who actually loves boba more than you. At first it seemed impossible, but
you slowly accepted her superiority in boba fandom.

Going DOWN leads to the ground floor and outside the dorm.

You talk to your friend. When you tell her that you are going to
get boba, her face slightly shivers from the chaotic mixture of desire
and restraint. After a few seconds, she shakes her head.
This is quite surprising.

Respecting her decision, you walk DOWN the stairs, out into the streets.

The air is oddly cool for a September day. The gorge silently roars
underneath. In it there was a crystallized beauty that you don't notice
anymore because you got used to it. You think to yourself that one day you
should bring out your guitar and relax in the natural scene. Towards your BACK
is your dorm, whose architecture fits so well with the view.

But now is not the time. Your mind is set on only one thing now.

You ask yourself which one you want to go to:
Kung Fu Tea that is to the LEFT, or Panda Tea Lounge to the RIGHT.

It was only when you stood in front of that cold, closed door, did you
realize that Kung Fu Tea doesn't stay open this late.

However, you are determined to get that boba. So you turn BACK.

You arrive at Panda Tea Lounge. The warmth and scent enwraps you in a
state of bliss. The anticipation builds up. It is a bit late in the night,
so there aren't that many people inside. The cashier recognizes you,
mostly because you come so often. The coolness from OUTSIDE seeps in.

You first check if you brought your *money* with you from the dorm.

You give the *money* to the cashier and proceed to PAY.

After what felt like an eternity, the worker calls your order number.
You excitedly go up towards her and see two cups of boba.

You behold the hue of the liquid that reminds you of the late sunset you
saw on the way back from classes. You feel your exhaustion fade away.
The dark-colored bubbles poised geometrically on top of one another give
you vague ideas on how to implement your TAG for CS 3110.

You want to drink your boba here, but you decide you'd like to share this
experience with your roommate. So you take the *boba* and head back OUTSIDE.

You shiver slightly from the cool wind and the icy cups of boba in your hands,
but you are content. Complete serenity overtakes you, and you appreciate
once again the gorge and the trees as you walk past them.

You make sure you got your roommate's boba with you too. You look BEHIND
at Panda Tea Lounge.

You walk towards your dorm and take the stairs UP to your room.

You return to your room, triumphant and calm. You briefly admire your cup and proceed to inhale it.
The moment, with the flavorings and ice swirling like gold in your mouth,
feels just as eternal as time you waited for it.

You *give* your roommate his cup of -boba-. The night grew pleasantly old.

items.description: room keys that dangle from a metal ring

you need this to participate in any economic activity, but the only thing
you care about at the moment is buying that boba.
the sweetest of delights on a late CS nights
